title.narrative: Afghanistan COVID-19 Emergency Response and Health Systems Preparedness Project

description.narrative: The project development objective is to respond to, and mitigate the threat posed by COVID-19 and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness in Afghanistan.

title.narrative: Presence of a Biosafety Level 2 facility in each of 5 regions
Proportion of identified contacts who are successfully traced
Proportion of provincial hospital doctors and nurses who are trained on WHO standards of clinical treatment for COVID-19
Proportion of population able to identify three key symptoms of COVID-19 and three personal prevention measures
Proportion of hospitals contracted for COVID-19 treatment with adequate isolation treatment available
Proportion of specimens submitted for COVID-19 virus laboratory testing with results available within 48 hours
Proportion of hospitals contracted for COVID-19 treatment with adequate personal protective equipment
Percentage of grievances resolved within a month of their receipt
Number of health workers who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19
Percentage of health facilities in the project area with functioning management committees having community representation
Community engagement plan implemented for increasing demand creation for the Covid-19 vaccine by the population
National plan developed for COVID-19 vaccine procurement and deployment
Percentage of EPI fixed vaccination centers with a female staff present
Percentage of population vaccinated, which is included in the priority population targets defined in national plan [by gender].
Number of solarized cold storage and health facilities
